fields.text:
Superb Italian cuisine delivered conveniently! Fast delivery, fresh ingredients, and rich flavors - pure delight! 
And high level of customer support service!
fields.author: Anna Ivanova

fields.text: This Italian cuisine delivery restaurant is a real gem! Exquisite dishes, perfectly cooked and prepared with love. I always order again!
fields.author: Maxim Petrov

fields.text: Excellent Italian cuisine that you can enjoy at home. Well-balanced flavors, attentive staff, and excellent service. I will order more in the future!
fields.author: Elena Smirnova

fields.text: A perfect combination of quality and taste! The delivery was fast, the food was warm and flavorful. A true piece of Italy right at your doorstep. This is my favorite delivery!
fields.author: Alexey Kozlov

fields.text: A taste that mesmerizes! The Italian cuisine delivery restaurant will delight you with exquisite dishes and true Italian flair. Highly recommended!
fields.author: Olga Morozova

fields.text: I'm never disappointed with this Italian cuisine delivery restaurant. Amazing flavor combinations, superb quality, and unparalleled service.
fields.author: Igor Kuznetsov

fields.text: An enchanting delivery restaurant that will please even the most discerning gourmet. Italian delicacies, attention to detail, and a pleasant atmosphere.
fields.author: Natalia Volkova

fields.name: Pepperoni Pizza
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Thin crust made from wheat flour
Tomato sauce
Mozzarella cheese
Pepperoni (spicy beef sausage)
Chili pepper (optional)
Italian herbs (a blend of basil, oregano, and rosemary)
Fresh basil (for garnish)
Pepperoni pizza is a classic dish from Italian cuisine, known for its rich flavor and delicious combination of spicy pepperoni sausage and melted mozzarella cheese. The thin crust, tomato sauce, and aromatic Italian herbs add zest and depth to the taste. For those who enjoy spice, a few slices of chili pepper can be added. Pepperoni pizza is often garnished with fresh basil to accentuate its Italian roots.

The pizza will be prepared and delivered to you fresh and hot, so you can enjoy this delightful dish right in the comfort of your own home.

fields.name: Margherita pizza
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Thin crust made from wheat flour
Tomato sauce
Fresh mozzarella cheese
Fresh basil leaves
Extra-virgin olive oil
Salt and pepper 
Margherita pizza is a timeless classic that embodies the simplicity and elegance of Italian cuisine. It features a thin crust made from wheat flour, topped with a flavorful tomato sauce. The star of the show is the fresh mozzarella cheese, which melts beautifully to create a creamy and indulgent base. To enhance the aroma and freshness, fragrant basil leaves are scattered across the pizza. A drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil adds a touch of richness, while a sprinkle of salt and pepper completes the harmonious flavor profile.

This pizza is a celebration of the finest ingredients, allowing each component to shine through. It is a true crowd-pleaser, loved for its delicate balance and clean, vibrant flavors. The Margherita pizza is prepared with care and delivered to your doorstep, ensuring that you can savor its deliciousness in the comfort of your own home.

fields.name: Four Cheese Pizza
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Thin crust made from wheat flour
Tomato sauce
Mozzarella cheese
Gouda cheese
Blue cheese
Parmesan cheese
Italian herbs (a blend of basil, oregano, and rosemary)
Fresh basil 

Four Cheese Pizza is a true delight for cheese connoisseurs. The thin crust made from wheat flour serves as the perfect base for a luscious tomato sauce. This pizza is literally covered in a sea of cheeses: mozzarella, gouda, blue cheese, and parmesan. Mozzarella brings smoothness and tenderness, gouda adds a mild flavor, blue cheese provides a salty and tangy kick, while parmesan contributes its unique aroma. Generously sprinkled with a blend of Italian herbs, it offers depth of flavor, and fresh basil garnishes the pizza, enhancing its aroma and aesthetics.

Four Cheese Pizza is a celebration for cheese lovers. Each cheese imparts its own distinct character, creating a harmonious and rich taste profile. Enjoy this exquisite dish, prepared with love and delivered straight to your table.

fields.name: Vegetarian Pizza
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Thin crust made from wheat flour
Tomato sauce
Mozzarella cheese
Feta cheese
Mushrooms
Tomatoes
Sweet bell peppers
Onion
Olive oil
Italian herbs (a blend of basil, oregano, and rosemary)
Fresh basil 

Vegetarian Pizza is a dish that delights not only vegetarians but also anyone who appreciates fresh and flavorful ingredients. The thin crust made from wheat flour serves as the base for a mouthwatering tomato sauce. This pizza showcases a variety of cheeses: melty mozzarella and crumbled feta, providing a salty and delicate touch. Mushrooms, tomatoes, sweet bell peppers, and onion add a variety of textures and freshness. Olive oil and a blend of Italian herbs, including basil, oregano, and rosemary, are used for seasoning. The pizza is garnished with fresh basil, enhancing its appetizing appearance.

Vegetarian Pizza is a culinary delight for all lovers of plant-based cuisine. It offers a range of flavors and textures, reflecting the richness of fresh vegetables and cheeses. Enjoy this exquisite dish, prepared with care and delivered straight to your table.

fields.name: Prosciutto Funghi Pizza
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Thin crust made from wheat flour
Tomato sauce
Mozzarella cheese
Prosciutto ham
Mushrooms (usually button mushrooms)
Parmesan cheese
Fresh arugula (for garnish)
Olive oil
Salt and pepper 

Prosciutto Funghi Pizza is an exquisite combination of savory prosciutto ham, flavorful mushrooms, and delicate cheese on a thin wheat crust. It features a delicious tomato sauce as the base, while the melted mozzarella cheese creates a creamy foundation. The Prosciutto ham adds a salty and rich taste, and the mushrooms provide texture and aroma. Parmesan cheese complements the composition with its rich flavor profile. Before serving, the pizza is garnished with fresh arugula, adding a touch of freshness and aesthetic appeal. For additional flavor variation, we add a drizzle of olive oil, salt and pepper. 

Prosciutto Funghi Pizza is a delight for connoisseurs of refined Italian cuisine. Each ingredient contributes its own unique element, creating a perfect harmony of flavors. Enjoy this exquisite dish, prepared with love and delivered straight to your table.

fields.name: Carbonara Pasta
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Spaghetti from wheat flour
Guanciale (Italian air-dried pork cheek) or pancetta (Italian bacon)
Egg yolks
Parmesan cheese
Freshly ground black pepper
Salt 
Fresh parsley 

Carbonara Pasta is a classic Italian dish known for its rich flavor and simplicity. It starts with fresh spaghetti cooked until al dente, achieving the perfect balance of firmness. The highlight of the dish is guanciale or pancetta, which imparts a unique aromatic note to the Carbonara. Egg yolks add creaminess and a rich taste. A generous sprinkling of Parmesan cheese adds depth and richness to the pasta. Freshly ground black pepper and salt provide a touch of spiciness and season the dish to taste. Before serving, Carbonara Pasta is garnished with fresh parsley, enhancing its appetizing appearance.

Carbonara Pasta is a celebration of Italian cuisine, enchanting you with refined flavors and aromas. Enjoy this exquisite dish, prepared with love and a passion for Italian culinary traditions.

fields.name: Bolognese Pasta
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Spaghetti from wheat flour
Ground beef
Carrot
Celery
Garlic
Tomato paste
Crushed tomatoes
Red wine 
Beef broth
Olive oil
Italian herbs (a blend of basil, oregano, and thyme)
Salt and pepper 
Fresh parsley 
Parmesan cheese 

Bolognese Pasta is a timeless Italian dish that captivates with its hearty and robust flavors. It begins with al dente spaghetti, perfectly cooked to retain a satisfying bite. The star of the show is the flavorful ground beef, simmered with a medley of finely chopped onion, carrot, celery, and garlic. Tomato paste and crushed tomatoes add a rich tomato base, while a splash of red wine enhances the complexity of the sauce. Beef broth further enriches the flavors, resulting in a luscious and savory Bolognese sauce. A drizzle of olive oil and a blend of Italian herbs, including basil, oregano, and thyme, enhance the aromatic profile.

Bolognese Pasta is a beloved classic that showcases the essence of Italian comfort food. Indulge in this exquisite dish, prepared with care and respect for traditional flavors.

fields.name: Tagliatelle with Shrimp in Creamy Sauce
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Tagliatelle pasta
Shrimp (peeled and deveined)
Garlic
Shallot
Cream
White wine
Fresh parsley (finely chopped)
Lemon juice
Salt and pepper 
Parmesan cheese 

Tagliatelle with Shrimp in Creamy Sauce is an exquisite dish that combines fresh seafood with a rich and creamy sauce. Tagliatelle pasta, with its wide and flat ribbons, perfectly holds the flavorful sauce. The shrimp adds a touch of freshness and tenderness, and their succulent taste pairs beautifully with sautéed garlic and shallots. Cream adds richness and creaminess, while white wine enhances the aroma of the seafood. A sprinkle of freshly chopped parsley and a splash of lemon juice add a fresh and vibrant taste to the pasta. 

Tagliatelle with Shrimp in Creamy Sauce is an Italian delicacy that delights food enthusiasts with its richness and elegant combination of ingredients. Indulge in this refined dish, prepared with love and meticulous attention to detail.

fields.name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio with Shrimp
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Spaghetti
Shrimp (peeled and deveined)
Garlic
Olive oil
Red pepper flakes
Fresh parsley (finely chopped)
Salt 

Spaghetti Aglio e Olio with Shrimp is a classic Italian dish that is simple to prepare yet impresses with its rich flavors. The foundation of this pasta is al dente cooked spaghetti, tender and resilient pasta ribbons. The shrimp adds freshness and tenderness to the dish, while garlic and olive oil create the base of a flavorful sauce. Red pepper flakes add a hint of spice, and freshly chopped parsley brings a vibrant and fresh taste to the pasta. The harmonious combination of ingredients creates a sublime dish that is incredibly appetizing and enticing.

Spaghetti Aglio e Olio with Shrimp is a celebration of Italian cuisine, allowing you to savor the simplicity and purity of flavors. Unwind and indulge in this exquisite dish, prepared with love and respect for the traditions of Italian culinary art.

fields.name: Four Cheese Pasta with Truffle
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Pasta (penne or fettuccine)
Gorgonzola (blue cheese)
Parmesan (hard cheese)
Pecorino (sharp cheese)
Mozzarella (soft cheese)
Garlic
Cream
Truffle oil
Salt and pepper (to taste)
Fresh basil

Four Cheese Pasta with Truffle is an embodiment of elegance and gastronomic pleasure. It is based on the combination of several types of cheese, each imparting its own distinct note to the dish. Gorgonzola adds tanginess and creaminess, Parmesan brings richness and a slightly salty taste, Pecorino contributes sharpness and delicate piquancy, while Mozzarella lends a soft and creamy texture to the sauce. Garlic and cream create the base of the aromatic sauce, while truffle oil adds luxury and sophistication. The pasta is cooked al dente to maintain its firmness and texture. 

Four Cheese Pasta with Truffle is an embodiment of Italian gastronomic refinement that captivates the eyes and delights the taste buds. Allow yourself to indulge in this exquisite dish, prepared with love and meticulous attention to detail.

fields.name: Aranciata
fields.description:
Aranciata is a refreshing and invigorating beverage that energizes and uplifts the spirits. Originally hailing from Sicily, this drink has gained popularity worldwide due to its vibrant flavor and unique ambiance it creates.

Aranciata is crafted from the juice of fresh oranges, combined with a natural syrup made from mandarins, known as "marenghi," adding citrus harmony to the mix. The beverage boasts a bright orange color and a refreshing aroma that unfolds with every sip.

The taste of Aranciata balances the sweetness of ripe oranges with a subtle tanginess of citrus, creating a harmonious blend on the palate. It has a pleasant texture and a gentle effervescence that adds playfulness to each gulp. Aranciata is perfect for cooling off on a hot day or simply enjoying a fresh and fruity drink at any time of the year.

Crafted with care using only natural ingredients, Aranciata offers a distinctive taste and an unforgettable experience. Try this Italian classic beverage and immerse yourself in the world of authentic Sicilian gastronomy.

fields.name: Crodino
fields.description:
Crodino is a unique Italian non-alcoholic beverage that delights with its fresh and fruity flavor. It has become an icon of Italian culture and is popular for its refined and invigorating nature.

Crodino is crafted from carefully selected citrus fruits and herbal extracts, giving it a distinctive character. The beverage has a bright amber color and a pleasant aroma that fills the air with freshness and energy.

The taste of Crodino is rich with fruity notes, balancing the sweetness of oranges and lemons with a gentle bitterness from the herbal ingredients. It has a harmonious texture and a delicate effervescence that creates a pleasant tangy sensation on the palate. Crodino is perfect for enjoying its refreshing taste at any time of the day.

Crodino is not just a beverage, it is a part of Italian culture and lifestyle. It is made with love and careful selection of natural ingredients to offer you a unique and unforgettable journey into the world of Italian gastronomy. Try Crodino and indulge in its distinctive and invigorating character that will delight you with every sip.

fields.name: Chinotto
fields.description:
Chinotto is a classic Italian carbonated beverage with a unique taste and aroma. It represents the perfect blend of citrus and herbal notes, creating a distinct and refreshing drink.

Chinotto is made from carefully selected ingredients, including orange and lemon peels, infused with secret herbal extracts. The beverage boasts a rich caramel color and a fresh aroma that unfolds with every sip.

The taste of Chinotto is characterized by sweet and bittersweet citrus nuances, balanced with gentle bitterness and herbal undertones. It has a refreshing texture and moderate carbonation, creating a pleasant sensation on the palate. Chinotto is perfect for enjoying its refreshing taste at any time of the day.

Chinotto embodies the Italian passion and zest for life. It is crafted with respect for traditions and using only the finest ingredients to offer you a unique and unforgettable taste experience. Discover Chinotto and let this classic Italian beverage immerse you in the atmosphere of Italian gastronomy.

fields.name: Marocchino
fields.description:
Marocchino is an authentic Italian beverage that combines the delicacy of espresso with the richness of chocolate. It is a true delight for coffee and sweet lovers, offering genuine pleasure and gastronomic indulgence.

Marochino is prepared using espresso and steamed milk, infused with a gentle chocolate syrup. The beverage showcases a deep brown color and an enticing aroma that fills the air, tempting and awakening the senses.

The taste of Marochino is rich with the harmony of coffee and chocolate, featuring subtle sweetness and a delicate hint of bitterness, creating a perfect balance on the palate. It has a smooth and creamy texture that immerses you in a luxurious taste experience. Marochino is perfect for savoring in a cozy setting or enjoying in the company of friends.

Marochino is the art of blending coffee and chocolate, bringing Italian passion and joy into your cup. Indulge in this authentic Italian beverage, crafted with love and artistry, and allow yourself to immerse in the world of true Italian gastronomic experience.

fields.name: Cedrata
fields.description:
Cedrata is a refreshing Italian carbonated beverage with a unique blend of citrus and herbal flavors. It offers true pleasure and is the perfect companion on hot summer days.

Cedrata is crafted from citrus extracts, including lemon and orange, combined with natural herbal ingredients. The beverage showcases a vibrant and appealing golden color that entices you to savor every sip.

The taste of Cedrata delights with the freshness of lemon, the sweetness of orange, subtle bitterness, and gentle herbal notes. It has a invigorating texture and pleasant carbonation, creating a light and refreshing sensation on the palate. Cedrata is perfect for quenching your thirst and enjoying its delightful taste at any time of the day.

Cedrata is an Italian classic that brings freshness and a rejuvenating experience in every bottle. It is made with quality ingredients to offer you an unmatched taste and satisfaction. Discover Cedrata and let this Italian beverage enliven your day and bring you moments of joy and delight.

fields.name: Bruschetta with Ricotta and Sweet Tomatoes
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Slices of fresh bread (grilled)
Ricotta cheese - a delicate Italian cheese
Sweet tomatoes - juicy and ripe, thinly sliced
Fresh basil - for aromatic and green garnish
Extra Virgin olive oil - for added richness and noble flavor
Salt and pepper 

Bruschetta with Ricotta and Sweet Tomatoes is an authentic Italian dish that offers an unparalleled combination of textures and flavors. Slices of fresh bread, grilled to a crisp golden crust, serve as the base for this bruschetta.

On each slice of bread, a generous portion of ricotta cheese is spread - a creamy and smooth Italian cheese with subtle acidic notes. Thin slices of sweet tomatoes are then added, providing the bruschetta with a fresh and fruity taste.

Bruschetta with Ricotta and Sweet Tomatoes is garnished with fresh basil, which adds aroma and freshness to each bite. Before serving, the bruschetta is drizzled with Extra Virgin olive oil, imparting a rich and noble flavor to the dish.

This dish is a perfect choice for lovers of Italian cuisine. Bruschetta with Ricotta and Sweet Tomatoes makes a wonderful appetizer or a delicious snack throughout the day. Its fresh and juicy taste will tempt you and leave you craving for more.

fields.name: Pizzaetta prosciutto fungi
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Thin round pizza dough
Flavorful tomato sauce
Mozzarella cheese
Prosciutto
Mushrooms
Fresh basil
Salt and pepper 

Pizzaetta is an appetizing Italian appetizer that pizza lovers will enjoy. It is a miniature version of pizza, perfect for snacking or sharing with friends.

A generous amount of flavorful tomato sauce is spread over the dough, infusing it with a rich and satisfying taste. Next, a generous portion of melted mozzarella cheese is sprinkled on top, creating a perfect blend with the dough and other ingredients.

The pizzaetta is then topped with slices of savory prosciutto, adding a tender and aromatic flavor. Sliced mushrooms are also added, providing a delightful earthy taste and adding a textural contrast to the appetizer.

Before baking, the pizzaetta is garnished with fresh basil, enhancing the dish with its aromatic freshness. 

The pizzaetta is baked in the oven until it acquires a golden crust while maintaining its thin and crispy texture, perfectly melding with the toppings. This small pizza offers a well-balanced combination of textures and flavors.

Pizzaetta with ham and mushrooms is an ideal appetizer for social gatherings or family dinners. It allows you to explore different tastes and enjoy the diversity of pizza in a mini format.

fields.name: Tramezzino Sandwich
fields.description:
Ingredients :

Soft white bread
Ham
Emmental cheese
Fresh lettuce leaves
Tomatoes
Mayonnaise for spreading
Salt and pepper 

The Tramezzino Sandwich is a classic Italian sandwich that has gained popularity for its simplicity and delicious flavor combinations.

Tramezzino Sandwich starts with two slices of soft white bread. The bread is chosen for its tender texture, ensuring a perfect pairing with the filling.

The slices of bread are spread with mayonnaise to add a touch of creaminess and enhance the taste. Next, a layer of ham is placed on one side of the bread, providing a savory and salty note to the sandwich.

On top of the ham, a thin layer of Emmental cheese is added, contributing a creamy and mild flavor to the filling. Fresh lettuce leaves are then placed, adding a crisp and refreshing element to the sandwich.

To finish, tomatoes are added on top of the lettuce, providing juiciness and a burst of freshness. A pinch of salt and pepper can be added to taste for seasoning.

The assembled Tramezzino Sandwich is carefully cut into halves or triangles, creating an appealing and appetizing presentation. This sandwich with ham, Emmental cheese, and fresh vegetables is perfect for a light snack or lunch.

The Tramezzino Sandwich with ham, Emmental cheese, and fresh vegetables offers a harmonious combination of flavors and textures that satisfies hunger and brings enjoyment.

fields.name: Beef Tartare with Parmesan Mousse
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Fresh high-quality beef, finely chopped
Capers, finely chopped
Fresh lemon juice
Dijon mustard
Soy sauce
Worcestershire sauce
Salt and freshly ground black pepper 
Parmesan cheese, grated
Cream

Beef Tartare with Parmesan Mousse is an exquisite dish that captivates with its combination of tender beef and flavorful Parmesan cheese.

To prepare the tartare, fresh high-quality beef is finely chopped to achieve the perfect texture. The beef 100% fresh and of exceptional quality to ensure both safety and enjoyment.

The tartare is enhanced with finely chopped capers , which add a special flavor accent to the dish. Fresh lemon juice is added for a refreshing touch and to bring brightness to the taste. Dijon mustard, soy sauce, and Worcestershire sauce are incorporated for depth and complexity of flavor.

Salt and freshly ground black pepper are added, achieving a harmonious balance of flavors. These simple seasonings accentuate the taste of the beef and provide a hint of spiciness and aroma to the tartare.

For the Parmesan mousse, grated Parmesan cheese and cream are combined until a smooth and creamy consistency is achieved. This Parmesan mousse adds a delicate and refined touch to the dish, creating a magnificent combination with the beef.

Beef Tartare with Parmesan Mousse is served on a plate, presenting an elegant appearance. It is perfect as an appetizer or a main course for those who appreciate exquisite Italian cuisine.

Indulge in the pleasure of juicy beef, flavorful Parmesan, and the sophisticated blend of spices in Beef Tartare with Parmesan Mousse.

fields.name: Salmon Tartare with Creamy Soft Cheese
fields.description:
Ingredients:

Fresh salmon fillet, finely chopped
Capers, finely chopped
Lemon juice
Fresh dill, finely chopped
Creamy soft cheese
Salt and freshly ground black pepper 
Toast for serving

Salmon Tartare with Creamy Soft Cheese is an exquisite dish that combines the fresh and delicate flavor of salmon with creamy soft cheese.

To prepare the tartare, fresh salmon fillet is finely chopped to achieve the perfect texture. The salmon 100% fresh and of high quality to ensure both safety and exceptional taste.

The tartare is enhanced with finely chopped capers, which add a unique aroma and a subtle spiciness to the dish. Lemon juice is added to bring a refreshing touch and to accentuate the flavors. Fresh dill, finely chopped, is incorporated to enhance the aromatic profile of the salmon.

Creamy soft cheese is mixed with the tartare, adding a smooth and creamy texture. The cheese brings richness and depth of flavor, creating a harmonious combination with the salmon.

Salt and freshly ground black pepper are added, achieving a perfect balance of flavors. These simple seasonings highlight the natural taste of the salmon and complement its delicate nature.

Salmon Tartare with Creamy Soft Cheese is served on toast, creating a delightful contrast of textures. It is perfect as an appetizer or a light main course for those who appreciate refined flavors.

fields.title: Interesting Pizza Facts
fields.content:
1. Square pizza

The shape of the original Italian pizza was square. Today it is better known as "Sicilian". At first, Romano cheese was also used to make pizza, and then they switched to mozzarella, beloved by many today.

2. The average slice of pizza is 25% protein.

This was reported by the US Department of Agriculture. In addition, pizza provides 35% of the daily protein intake.

3. One of the first documented online purchases was pizza.

Pepperoni with mushrooms and extra cheese. It was one of the first recorded purchases made online around 1994. More purchases are now made online than any other way.

4. Pizza Eating Record.

In 2006, Cristian Dumitru from Romania set a new world record by eating 90 kg of pizza in a week. Another record belongs to the Japanese Takeru Kobayashi, who in 2014 ate 62 slices of pizza (15 and a half pizzas) in 12 minutes.

5. Pizza Margherita was named after Queen Margherita of Italy.

Raffaele Esposito, a pizza maker, was commissioned by the Royal Palace to create a pizza in honor of Queen Margherita of Savoy. Of the three different pizzas he made, the queen's favorite was the pizza in the colors of the Italian flag - red (tomatoes), green (basil) and white (mozzarella).

fields.title: Interesting Pasta Facts
fields.content:
1. Etymology

As is known, all types of pasta are called "pasta" by Italians (and macaroni is just one of more than 350 varieties!). The name itself comes from the ancient Greek word "pasta," which translates to "flour with sauce."

2. History

Italian historians persistently argue to the world that spaghetti was widely consumed in Sicily at least two centuries before Marco Polo's journey to Asia. Therefore, even if he brought them in the 13th century as a "Chinese souvenir," it does not mean that they were first invented there. Scientists cite a 1154 guidebook by the Arab geographer Al-Idrisi as evidence, which mentions a "pasta product in the form of threads" originating from Palermo.

3. Hygiene

Up until the 19th century, pasta dough was kneaded... with feet. Workers would tread barefoot to the music played on the mandolin. This continued until King Ferdinand II of the Two Sicilies (1830-1859) hired engineers to design a new, more hygienic and automated production system.

4. Health

Pasta provides a lot of energy to the body and is good against stress because the B-group vitamins it contains help the nervous system function properly, relieving muscle tension, headaches, insomnia, and even nervous ticks. They also improve mood since pasta increases serotonin production. They have a low glycemic index as complex carbohydrates, which helps prevent cardiovascular diseases and even tumors.

5. Quality

How to recognize quality Italian pasta? Here are three parameters to consider when choosing a product. Firstly, the amount of protein: a minimum content of 10.5% (11.5% for whole grain pasta). Secondly, the label "trafilata al bronzo": when pasta is processed with a special bronze mold, which makes its surface rough, it better "grabs" different sauces. Thirdly, the water after boiling: the clearer it is, the less starch and protein the pasta lost during the cooking process.

fields.title: Popular facts about Italian cuisine
fields.content:
Italian cuisine is one of the most famous and popular cuisines in the world, thanks to its unique and diverse culture and traditions. It is known for its simple yet delicious ingredient combinations, the use of natural and fresh ingredients, as well as the emphasis on seasonality and ingredient availability. Italian cuisine is also renowned for its famous dishes such as pasta, pizza, and tiramisu, as well as its wide use of herbs, spices, and cheeses. If you haven't tried Italian cuisine yet, we recommend experiencing its richness and variety, as it might become your favorite type of cuisine.
1. Italians are the largest consumers of pasta in the world. This is due to their culture and traditions. Italians consider pasta as the staple of their diet and eat it as a main dish rather than as a side or an accompaniment to meat or fish. Additionally, Italy has a wide variety of pasta types that differ in shape, size, and texture. 2. One of the most popular ingredients in Italian cuisine is tomatoes, which are used in the majority of dishes. Italians invented a method of preserving tomatoes that allows them to maintain freshness and flavor throughout the year. As a result, they can use fresh tomatoes even during the winter season. Moreover, tomatoes are a rich source of vitamin C and antioxidants. 3. Italian cuisine extensively utilizes cheeses such as Parmesan, mozzarella, and gorgonzola. Cheeses are used in many dishes, including pizza, pasta, and salads. Each region of Italy has its own unique cheeses that vary in texture and taste. 4. Caprese salad is one of the most popular salads in Italian cuisine. It consists of mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil. Caprese was invented on the island of Capri in the 1950s and quickly gained popularity worldwide. This salad is an excellent choice for a summer meal as it is very light and refreshing. 5. Seafood dishes such as calamari, octopus, mussels, and others are widely prevalent. This is due to Italy's geographical location along the Mediterranean coast. Seafood dishes are extensively used in Italian cuisine and have a multitude of preparation options, from fried to stewed.

fields.title: Italian Cuisine: The Perfect Food Formula
fields.content:
Features of Italian Cuisine
Italian food is undeniably one of the most visually appealing cuisines in the world, and the nature of its attractiveness is easily explained - it reflects the landscape and scenery, the sky and the sea, the village and the city, revealing the character of an Italian and their attitude towards life. And the attitude towards food itself, as the first Italian culinary book dates back to the first century BC. This fact speaks for itself! The importance that ancient people attached to food and its preparation processes is still distinctly felt in Italy today, especially when compared to other countries where the main criterion has become the speed of consumption rather than its quality. Traditional Italian cuisine originated in ancient Rome. Descriptions of luxurious feasts hosted by the Roman general Lucullus have come down to us to this day. Among other exquisite dishes, they served rooster combs, flamingo tongue pâté, pheasant brains, whole roasted pig carcasses on a spit. That's why even now, a sumptuous feast with an abundance of delicacies is called "Lucullan banquet". Of course, in Italy, thousands of beautiful birds are no longer slaughtered for the gastronomic pleasure of the wealthy gourmets. But the main ingredients of Italian cuisine have remained unchanged for many centuries. These include fish and seafood, olive oil, various types of cheese, mushrooms, nuts, natural wine, fresh vegetables, and fruits. Such a combination of ingredients allows for the preparation of many delicious and nutritionally rich dishes, which is why Italian cuisine is considered one of the healthiest. This is also due to the peculiarities of Italian food preparation. In Italy, vegetables and pasta are not overcooked; the heat treatment should be minimal. "Al dente" is the accepted degree of doneness, which helps preserve vitamins, pleasant crunch, and vibrant color in the ingredients. To ensure that meat or fish pieces are crispy on the outside but juicy on the inside, they are often grilled. The culture of cultivating olives and obtaining olive oil from them has existed in Italy since ancient times. It is a kind of art, a national treasure. Olive oil is used in sauces, bruschetta, all types of pasta, and added to pizza dough. Ingredients, season, region - this is the formula for success in the national cuisine that each person who is fortunate enough to experience the hospitality of beautiful Italy will discover for themselves.

fields.title: Misconceptions about Italian cuisine
fields.content:
5 Serious Misconceptions about Italian Cuisine
It seems like we know everything about Italian dishes. However, unfortunately, our most common beliefs about Italian cuisine are stereotypes. Singing odes to Italian cuisine is never-ending. Amazing cheeses, divine gelato, and exquisite wine are not exaggerations but everyday realities in the trattorias and osterias of this country. Pasta, carpaccio, caprese, and tiramisu - it seems like we know everything about these dishes. Unfortunately, our most common beliefs about Italian cuisine are stereotypes.

1. The famous Bolognese sauce is not eaten with spaghetti.

The meat sauce in tomato sauce is served with tagliatelle, pappardelle, and cappelletti (varieties of pasta). It is also used as a filling for lasagna and eaten with mashed potatoes.

2. Ketchup is not a tomato sauce.

Italians don't like it (to put it mildly), they don't add it to pasta, and they would never offer such a "perilous mixture" in a restaurant.

3. Pizza is a separate dish, not an appetizer to share.

One person, one pizza.

4. In Italy, tables are rarely covered with red and white checkered tablecloths.

Trattorias and pastry shops prefer a solid color palette. However, for some reason, Russian restaurateurs are fond of this pattern.

5. Italians are not particularly fond of cappuccino.

If they do drink it, it's usually in the first half of the day, often for breakfast instead of dessert (because of its high calorie content). In other times, they prefer concentrated ristretto or corretto. Cappuccino, like latte, is a drink for tourists.

fields.title: Strange Habits of Italians That Russians Can't Understand
fields.preview: 5 Strange Habits of Italians That Russians Can't Understand
fields.content:
5 Strange Habits of Italians That Russians Can't Understand1. Road chaos
Italians are highly emotional and temperamental, and it reflects in their driving culture. They love fast driving, cutting corners, impatiently honking at traffic lights, and sometimes even running red lights. This creates an atmosphere of chaos on Italian roads, which shocks foreigners. However, surprisingly, this blatant disregard for traffic rules and ignoring signals doesn't result in a high number of accidents in Italy. It often seems like the locals possess some special Italian principles of safe driving that remain a mystery to tourists.

2. "What did you have for lunch today?"

Apart from the emotional greetings and the obligatory "How are you?" question, Italians always inquire about what their friends had for lunch. From an outsider's perspective, this curiosity might seem somewhat strange or even inappropriate, but for locals, it's perfectly normal. Whether you dined at a trendy restaurant or had a homemade meal with your mom, your friend will listen attentively to all the details of your gastronomic experience with genuine interest.

3. Let's disperse, it's siesta time

Are you looking for a 24-hour Italian supermarket or gas station? Well, good luck with that. Such establishments are a rarity in Italy and can only be found in major cities in the north of the country. In the south, however, all shops, gas stations, and restaurants close daily at 1 p.m. because it's siesta time—a period of post-lunch relaxation. The sellers don't return to their counters before 3 p.m., so keep this in mind when planning your daytime shopping.

4. Genuine displays of friendship that can leave you blushing

Italians are indeed a tactile nation. So, if you've met and engaged in a conversation with a local, don't be alarmed if they hug you and plant kisses on both your cheeks when they see you next. It's a standard friendly greeting for Italians (yes, they already consider you their friend). And if you spot men walking together holding hands, don't jump to conclusions. There's a high chance that they're not gay but just good friends. It's their way of showing their attachment to each other.

5. Italian politeness

Greeting phrases are considered good manners in Italy, and locals sometimes use them in the most peculiar situations—at least, from a foreigner's perspective. For example, if an Italian visits you at your home, they will greet you before you even reach the gate. Then, they will ask, "Permesso?" before crossing the threshold of your house. And upon entering the living room, they will inevitably say, "Buon giorno!" or "Buona sera!" (depending on the time of day). It won't bother them in the slightest that the room is empty or even in darkness. Good manners are ingrained in Italians' DNA.
